alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 9:05PM EST until December 20 at 1:24PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Oxford, Franklin and Androscoggin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Rumford. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Carlton and Dix Streets in Mexico. At 20.6 feet, This is a 100 year flood. In Mexico, flooding occurs on Riverside Avenue, Dix Avenue, Holman Avenue, Osgood Avenue, Carlton Avenue, and Flood Street. In Rumford, flooding occurs on Propect Avenue, Eaton Hill Road, Front Street, and Sunnyside Terrace. Hundreds of acres of farm fields also flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Tuesday was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.4 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
